column4: Okay I start Ubuntu 11.10 with live cd on my laptop which has a HDD with bad sectors. Any free program available like DD_rescue to try to recover the data on the HDD before I change it? I can't get to install dd_rescue, could you tell me how to install it? Or any other program?
I did download gddrescue directly through firefox, but it just doesn't let me ./configure
You dont need ddrescue. You can just use dd by itself. It should be on the livecd
start out by looking at your partitions. --> sudo fdisk -l
